Created attachment 560343
index.html

User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; WOW64; rv:2.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/4.0
Build ID: 20110318052756

Steps to reproduce:

Our site temporarily is placed on another page.
Using PHP we created a HTTP 302 redirect so the user automatically visits the new page.

On the new page we check the HTTP REFERER. To check the referer


Actual results:

When a visitor has javascript enabled in options -> content the HTTP REFERER will be filled correctly.

However when the user disables javascript in options -> content the HTTP REFERER will be empty.


Expected results:

The HTTP REFERER should be filled, even if people disable javascript. Since javascript doesn't have anything to do with the HTTP REFERER
